item.title: Github
item.description: As a reminder, Git is a tool for version controlling your code. Your code is committed into repositories, where each project has its own repository. For this course, all projects and assignments will be organized into one repository. GitHub is a service that hosts a copy of your git repository online. This makes it easy for others to contribute to, and most importantly host it online as a website. At this point your repository on your computer probably looks like this:
